item.title: All traffic lights are out, 21st July
item.description:
All traffic lights are out on this roundabout. It is a major junction, very busy. People are becoming inpatient. Big accident waiting to happen
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Plants in Hanging Planters, 21st July
item.description:
Another failure on the part of the council. There are dozens of hanging flower planters on Kensington Church Street, (the street name changes along the way), running between Notting Hill Gate and Kensington High Street and all are filled with dead plants. Why plant these if you are not going to water them?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kensington Church Street, Kensington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The pavement needs reducing to allow vehicles to turn left from the sloane hospital end of Albermarle Road into Downs Vridge Rd. It is a remnant of when this part of Albermarle Road was on way so now needs correcting. Albermarle should be 2 way here still, 21st July

item.title: Brambles over growing on pavement, 21st July
item.description:
All along the opposite side to the house, the thorns and brambles are overgrown and cover the pavement reducing accessibility (and also you can scratch yourself). It seems completely differently managed from the downhill part of Hyde Vale where weeding and pruning have been more effective

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clayton Mews, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two sunken drains, 21st July
item.description:
There are two drains in the High Street, which are deeply sunken and could do damage to cars driving over them. They have been like this for sometime they could also cause motorbike accidents as they are really deeply sunken.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 254, High Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe fire damage to 2 trees, 21st July
item.description:
2 trees directly behind 75 Birchwood Avenue and adjacent to the footpath leading into Waring Park went up in flames on Friday 11 July which had to be extinguished by the Fire Brigade. There is severe fire damage to both trees. This is an extreme hazard to both people and property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birchwood Avenue, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting blocked by tree foliage, 21st July
item.description:
The street lights have been covered in foliage and over the last few months with the vegetation growing, the light does not reach the pavement anymore. This problem will only get worse in the autumn especially until all the leaves have dropped.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clayton Mews, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dry cinder wood dumped at the communal parking, 21st July
item.description:
Please note we woke up one of the days at Nightingale Corner parking ( BR5 3PS) and there was dry cinder wood left at one of the parking slots. This has been around for the past 3 weeks and i am worried that it is a fire hazard. a vandal might light this fire and all the nearby cars will be damaged. I am saying this as something similar happened in the bins where old chairs were lit of fire resulting in the same flats being evacuated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nightingale Corner, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
